item.title: USDC Treasury Mints Additional 500 Million USDC on the Solana Blockchain
item.description: On August 21st, as monitored by Whale Alert, the USDC Treasury has minted an extra 5 billion USDC on the Solana blockchain. This minting was carried out in two separate transactions, with 2.5 billion USDC minted in each transaction.

item.title: Boston Fed: Another Rate Cut Possible Later This Year
item.description: On August 21st, the President of the Boston Fed stated that the Federal Reserve might cut interest rates one more time during this year.

item.title: OKB achieved a 24-hour spot trading volume of $800 million on the OKX platform, surpassing Bitcoin.
item.description: On August 21st, the 24-hour spot trading volume of OKB on the OKX platform reached $800 million, surpassing Bitcoin ($628 million) and temporarily ranking second, only after Ethereum ($915 million). The 24-hour price increase of OKB reached 54.23%, and it is currently trading at $203.31.

item.title: Suspected Lion Group Holding Address sold $500,000 worth of HYPE 3 days ago, after previously announcing a $600 million funding round for the launch of the HYPE Treasury Strategy.
item.description: August 21st. According to the monitoring of HyperInsight at hyperliquid.xyz/join/NTOD, a suspected address of Lion Group Holding sold 12,000 HYPE tokens (approximately $500,000) three days ago.Previously, on June 19th, the Nasdaq-listed Lion Group Holding secured a $600 million investment to launch its HYPE Treasury Strategy. The company intends to use HYPE as its primary reserve asset and establish a next-generation Layer-1 Treasury Asset Portfolio with SOL and SUI.

item.title: Federal Reserve Bank of Boston: Inflation Rate Still Well Above the Fed's 2% Target
item.description: On August 21st, the Federal Reserve's Boston Fed stated that the inflation rate remains significantly above the Fed's 2% target. The Fed's policy is geared towards bringing the inflation rate back to 2%. (Xinhua News Agency)

item.title: Former Fed 'Hawk': Does Indeed Believe Fed Will Cut Rates in September
item.description: August 21st: Former President Bullard of the St. Louis Fed expressed the belief that the Fed will implement rate cuts in September. He also had communication with U.S. Treasury Secretary Yellen regarding the position of the Fed chair. (Xinhua Finance)

item.title: Former Fed Hawk: Current Interest Rates are High, Could Cut by 100 Basis Points by 2026
item.description: August 21st. The former president of the St. Louis Fed, Bullard, stated that the current interest rates are at a relatively high level and there is a possibility of a 100-basis-point cut by 2026. Additionally, the Fed also needs to focus on maintaining the reserve status of the US dollar. (FX168)

item.title: Greeks.Live: Market Sentiment Shows Cautious Bullishness, Traders Believe ETH Has Bottomed Out
item.description: On August 21st, Greek.Live issued its daily market briefing which said, "The community has demonstrated a cautious bullish sentiment. Traders think that ETH has reached the bottom and are waiting for a potential trend reversal. The key attention is on ETH's strong performance compared to BTC. Meanwhile, traders maintain a certain exposure by selling put options and taking profits on call options for the purpose of risk management."

item.title: The probability of a Fed rate cut in September is 79.1%
item.description: On August 21st, based on CME's "FedWatch" tool, the likelihood of the Fed keeping interest rates unchanged in September is 20.9%, and the probability of a 25-basis-point interest rate cut is 79.1%.

item.title: The EU and the US Reach Agreement on Finalizing Trade Deal Joint Statement
item.description: On August 21st, the EU and the US reached a joint statement regarding the finalization of a trade agreement. The EU intends to purchase $750 billion worth of US liquefied natural gas, oil, and nuclear energy products, as well as at least $400 billion worth of US artificial intelligence chips. It was reaffirmed that EU companies will make an additional investment of $600 billion in strategic areas in the US by 2028. (Golden Ten)
